intro: Valeriana woodsiana, commonly known as mountain valerian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its root system is valued in traditional medicine for its sedative properties. Valeriana woodsiana is an important species for pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
